channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The U.S. penny is discontinued—but this regional grocer is paying double if you exchange your coins. Here’s how to cash in
item.description: A regional supermarket chain is offering to buy pennies in a two-for-one deal. Sound like pennies from heaven? Too good to be true? The news comes a d...

item.title: From Barbie to Coach: Adobe is reinventing design with AI
item.description: For decades, Adobe’s software tools, including Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign, have been the universal language of visual communication, shaping...

item.title: Beehiiv Wants to Be the OS of the Creator Economy. These New Features Could Make It Happen
item.description: Tyler Denk, Beehiiv’s CEO, says that the platform is expanding because of the growing needs of content creators.

item.title: Neuroscience research says your next antiaging product should be Duolingo
item.description: Speaking multiple languages may protect both your brain and body by slowing down the biological aging process, increasing resilience as you get older,...

item.title: Palantir CEO Alex Karp says this type of prestigious college grad is doomed. People with expert knowledge will ‘make a lot more money’
item.description: The leader of the $439 billion tech company says those with niche knowledge will make “a lot more money” than Ivy League graduates with general expert...

item.title: Exclusive: Trump administration has yet to implement Elon Musk’s Grok on flagship AI app
item.description: While a deal to make Grok available across the federal government is now in place, the agency facilitating the partnership with Elon Musk’s controvers...

item.title: Top economist Mohamed El-Erian warns the AI bubble will ‘end in tears’ and credit ‘cockroaches’ abound
item.description: El-Erian argued that AI is a "rational bubble," but some have gone "beyond their comfort zone and beyond their ability to do due diligence."

item.title: Delta CEO slams ‘inexcusable’ shutdown that led to canceled flights and workers doing high-stress jobs without pay
item.description: "There was stress, there was strain, it was completely unnecessary," Ed Bastian told Yahoo Finance's Brian Sozzi.

item.title: This AI Coding Startup Just Minted 4 New Billionaires
item.description: Cursor, a popular platform for AI-powered coding, is now worth nearly $30 billion.

item.title: Economist behind K-shaped economy sees a ‘sea of despair’ for the bottom 90% and a ‘crisis of confidence’ in the American dream
item.description: “At the bottom, this mindset develops where they recognize that they may never win, but that doesn't mean, ‘I can't help you lose,’” Peter Atwater sai...

item.title: How Tariffs Are Making Workplaces More Dangerous
item.description: More expensive safety equipment means most businesses are delaying orders of employee protective gear, or using cheap alternatives that could raise ac...

item.title: Uber’s newest button takes you somewhere surprising
item.description: The headache of planning a ski trip stands in sharp contrast to the freedom of effortlessly slicing down the slopes once you actually get up the mount...

item.title: Mark Cuban Shares the Smartest Places for AI-Skilled Workers to Find Jobs
item.description: After urging current and future job hunters to use every free minute to learn AI skills, the serial entrepreneur tells people to market their abilitie...

item.title: A Beloved Buffalo Brewery Was Sold—Then Closed Its Taproom Doors
item.description: Economic pressures and lower alcohol consumption are forcing brewery closures across the country.

item.title: Palantir CEO slams ‘parasitic’ critics calling the tech a surveillance tool: ‘Not only is patriotism right, patriotism will make you rich’
item.description: “Our project is to make America so strong we never fight,” he said. “That’s very different than being almost strong enough, so you always fight.”
